DOC.TEXT: The stock market was narrowly mixed in light early trading today as bond prices declined. The Dow Jones average of 30 industrials was off 7.68 to 2,703.71 as of 10 a.m. Advancing issues were ahead of decliners, with 491 stocks rising, 355 declining and 438 unchanged on the New York Stock Exchange. Volume on the Big Board came to a light 11.4 million shares in the first half-hour of trading following the three-day Christmas holiday weekend. Hildegarde Zagorski, a stock market analyst with Prudential-Bache Securities Inc., said blue chip stocks were following the lead of bond prices, which declined in early trading today. The Treasury's 30-year bond was down | point, or $6.25 per $1,000 in face amount, while its yield rose to 7.93 from 7.88 late Friday. Ms. Zagorski also attributed today's early declines on Wall Street to profit-taking. The most-actively traded stock on the NYSE was Bank of New England, which rose \ to 7}. AT&T was up [ to 44~, IBM was off { to 94~, and Sears, Roebuck was up [ to 36~. The NYSE's composite index of all its listed common stocks fell 0.38 to 191.57. On the American Stock Exchange, the market value index fell 0.16 to 370.68. On Friday the Dow Jones industrial average climbed 20.26 to 2,711.39, cutting its loss for the week to 28.16 points. Advancing issues outnumbered declines by more than 2 to 1 on the NYSE, with 999 up, 475 down and 455 unchanged. Big Board volume totaled 120.98 million shares, against 175.15 million in the previous session.
